channel.title: Is it posable?
channel.description:
is it even posable for me to get a webclient like be able to upload or something like get the silabsoft client uploaded to a website so ppl can play my server from my website useing the silab client but be able to use the client only on my website so they don't have to download kinda like real runescape cause i been trying to do this and nothing works.
if some one can help me get a webclient working or point me to a tutorial for one please do so and i will be really really really greaful

item.title: Is it posable?
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Silab’s client isn’t open source (And afaik obfuscated), therefore you can’t convert the application into an applet.

item.title: Is it posable?
item.dc:creator: @caboose420 caboose420
item.description:
@caboose420 wrote:

can some one please just make me a tut for this lol i’m kinda stupid and i really wanted to make this for my server cause it’s a pain in the ass to keep telling ppl to go download the server and when they do they say it dosn’t work on thier computer and on my server they can’t get the new items if they arn’t useing silab client so can some one please make me a tutorial for this?

if i could rep some one for making me a tutorial i wil but i only got 14 rep and i can’t rep any one but if i get 15 rep i’ll remember ur name and i’ll rep u once i get the 15 rep points i need

Read full topic

item.title: Is it posable?
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

[quote=“Byty, post:4, topic:147240”]Well, first you are going to need to Upload the Client to you’re webserver, upload the client.jar file.

After that, just use this code. And save it as a web page.

[code]

WEBCLIENT NAME [/code][/quote]

No, he has to convert the application into an applet first and jar it.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it posable?

item.description:
@Byty wrote:

Well, first you are going to need to Upload the Client to you’re webserver, upload the client.jar file.

After that, just use this code. And save it as a web page.

[code]

WEBCLIENT NAME [/code]
